Articles.Content:
Finished downloading an hour ago (I searched for Free-to-Play game on Steam for reason unknown few days ago and add this and others to the library) and been playing until now.

RaceRoom Racing Experience is a Free2Race game that connects fans of racing around a game and motorsports portal.

Drivers begin their racing career in the portal and hit the track with plenty of free-to-play content. Five cars and two tracks are provided free to all registered users.

Licensed cars and tracks are available for purchase in the online store allowing players to build the game of their dreams.

The game is undergoing continuous development with new game modes, features and content being added regularly.

This game is in Beta (at least I heard it from a site), so multiplayer is not working right now. You can however, still race. Multiplayer release date is TBA, so do not expect it to happen in the next beta release.

Kerbal way of racing: race , crash , and get invalidated... (I got invalidated several times and yet I can still race. Weird.)

EDIT: Steam site link: http://store.steampowered.com/app/211500/?snr=1_7_15__13

It looks nice, but I hate the free-to-lay but money-todo-stuff games.

5 cars and 2 tracks? Really?

Quite annoying when you need Steam Wallet for points to buy stuff in game. Not sure when the multiplayer (not of KSP, but of the RaceRoom Racing Experience) is out. Looking forward to it. Then we can race each other. I have bad racing skills, though.

Edited November 17, 2013 by Designer225
